required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Research Study to Compare Two Forms of Semaglutide in Two Different Pen-injectors in People With Overweight or Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: A Trial to Demonstrate Bioequivalence Between Semaglutide Formulations With the DV3396 Pen-injector and With the PDS290 Pen-injector in Subjects With Overweight or Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: The study will look at how two different forms of semaglutide reach and stay in the blood after injection. None of the two forms of semaglutide have been approved by the authorities to treat obesity. Participants will get 1 of the 2 forms of semaglutide - which one is decided by chance. Participants will get the medicine as an injection under the skin of the stomach with the use of a pen-injector. The type of pen-injector is different for the two forms of semaglutide. The study staff will teach participants how to inject themselves with the medicine. As part of this training participants will self inject placebo (dummy medication) 3 times. Participants will take an injection once a week and will get 21 injections in total of study medication. The study will last for about 27-30 weeks. Participants will have 25 study visits with the study doctor. For 2 of the visits, participants will stay in the clinic for 3 days and 2 nights. Participants may have to stop the study if the study doctor thinks that there are risks for their health. Women cannot take part if they are pregnant, breast-feeding or planning to become pregnant during the study period.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The trial was terminated for strategic reasons.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-168h,2.4mg,SS: Area under the semaglutide concentration time curve following the last administration of semaglutide s.c. 2.4 mg
Cmax,2.4mg,SS: Maximum observed semaglutide concentration following the last administration of semaglutide s.c. 2.4 mg

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-168h,1mg,SS: Area under the semaglutide concentration time curve following the last administration of semaglutide s.c. 1 mg
Cmax,1mg,SS: Maximum observed semaglutide concentration following the last administration of semaglutide s.c. 1 mg
Tmax,2.4mg,SS: Time of maximum observed semaglutide concentration after last 2.4 mg dose
Tmax,1mg,SS: Time of maximum observed semaglutide concentration after last 1 mg dose
tÂ½: Terminal elimination half-life of semaglutide after last 2.4 mg dose
Cl/F2.4mg: Total apparent clearance of semaglutide after last 2.4 mg dose
Cl/F1mg: Total apparent clearance of semaglutide after last 1 mg dose
Vss/F2.4mg: Apparent volume of distribution at steady-state of semaglutide after last 2.4 mg dose
Vss/F1mg: Apparent volume of distribution at steady-state of semaglutide after last 1 mg dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (Day 1, pre-dose) until the end of treatment (Day 148)

arm_group.description: Participants will receive once-weekly doses of semaglutide administered with the DV3396 pen-injector (test drug product)
Participants will receive once-weekly doses of semaglutide administered with the PDS290 pen-injector (comparator drug product)

intervention.description: Increasing doses of semaglutide given subcutaneously (sc, under the skin) in the stomach for 21 weeks
Increasing doses of semaglutide given sc in the stomach for 21 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, aged 18-65 years (both inclusive) at the time of signing informed consent
- Body mass index (BMI) between 27.0 and 34.9 kg/m^2 (both inclusive)
- Body weight between 70.0 and 130.0 kg (both inclusive)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female who is pregnant, breast-feeding or intends to become pregnant or is of child-bearing potential and not using a highly effective contraceptive method
- Any disorder which in the investigator's opinion might jeopardise subject's safety or compliance with the protocol
- Inability or unwillingness to perform self-injection

patient_data.ipd_description: According to the Novo Nordisk disclosure commitment on novonordisk-trials.com
